title: Going thru divorce & filing individual Chapter 7, with 704 exemptions in California cuz spouse didn't sign homestead waiver
question: what code would alimony fall under in the California Code of Civil Procedure section?
question_tags: Divorce,Dividing debts in a divorce,Alimony,Divorce and bankruptcy,Bankruptcy,Bankruptcy exemptions,Debt,Nondischargeable debt and alimony,Bankruptcy and debt,Spousal debt,Marriage
answers:
California recognizes a 100% exemption for alimony, support, or seperate maintenance under section 703.140(b)(10)(D) of the California Code of Civil Procedure.

Section 704 does not provide an exemption for alimony or support. The exemptions in section 703 may be used in bankruptcy in lieu of the 704 exemptions. They cannot both be used at the same time.

There is spousal support in California, rather than alimony, and it is governed by and large by the California Family Code. If you look in the Family Code Index under "spousal support," you will find a number of Code sections dealing with different spousal support issues.
